__Introduction__:

This file combines all the data from CourtNet System and identify potential features.

```{r}
data_path = "../data/raw/"
```

### KY1 -- defendants
```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
Defendants = as.data.frame(fread(paste0(data_path,'01_KY_Recidivism_Defendants.txt'), 
                                 header = T)) %>% 
              select(PersonID, Gender, Race) %>%
              # rename to make consistent with Broward dataset
              rename(person_id = PersonID, 
                     sex = Gender, 
                     race = Race)
        

CNet_cases = as.data.frame(fread(paste0(data_path,'03_KY_Recidivism_CNet_Cases.txt'), 
                                 header = T)) %>% filter(County != "WHITLEY") %>%
              rename(person_id = PersonID,
                     seq_case_id = SeqCaseID)

CNet_charges = as.data.frame(fread(paste0(data_path,'06_KY_Recidivism_CNet_Charges.txt'),
                                   header = T)) %>% 
    rename(person_id = PersonId,
           seq_case_id = SeqCaseID) %>% 
    filter(County != "WHITLEY")

Sentences = as.data.frame(fread(paste0(data_path,'08_KY_Recidivism_Sentences.txt'), 
                                header = T)) %>% 
    rename(person_id = PersonId,
           seq_case_id = SeqCaseID) %>% 
    filter(County != "WHITLEY")

```

##### Combine Tables ###############################################################################

During the whole combination process, we will keep as many features as possible, which aims to keep as much information as possible, through renaming features and conducting sanity checking, which also ensures the correctness of combination.


## 1. Combine cases with defendants #######
```{r, message=FALSE}
memory.limit(size=56000)
comb1 = merge(x=Defendants,
              y=CNet_cases,
              by = "person_id")

nrow(comb1) == nrow(CNet_cases)
```

__NOTE__: no information added/lost. 

```{r}
colnames(comb1)
```

```{r}
comb1 = comb1 %>% 
    rename(Age_at_Case_Filing = Age_at_Filing,
           Case_FilingDate = FilingDate,
           Case_DispositionDate = DispositionDate)
```





## 2. Combine with charges ########
```{r}
comb2 = merge(x = comb1, 
              y=CNet_charges,
              by = c("person_id", "seq_case_id")) 

nrow(comb2) == nrow(CNet_charges)
```

__NOTE__: no information added/lost

```{r}
colnames(comb2)
```

__Sanity Check__:
There is no conflict of County, CountyCode, Division, and CaseNumberType between the cases and charges data sets. 

```{r}
sum(comb2$CountyCode.x == comb2$CountyCode.y) == nrow(comb2)
sum(comb2$County.x == comb2$County.y) == nrow(comb2)
sum(comb2$Division.x == comb2$Division.y) == nrow(comb2)
sum(comb2$CaseNumberType.x == comb2$CaseNumberType.y) == nrow(comb2)
```


```{r}
comb2 = comb2 %>% 
  select(-County.y,
         -CountyCode.y,
         -Division.y,
         -CaseNumberType.y) %>% 
  rename(CountyCode = CountyCode.x,
         County = County.x,
         Division = Division.x,
         Case_NumberType = CaseNumberType.x,
         ChargeType = type,
         Charge_DispositionDate = DispositionDate,
         Charge_DispositionCode = DispositionTypeCode,
         Charge_DispositionType = DispositionType,
         UOR_Class = UorClass,
         UOR_Level = UorLevel,
         UOR_Code = "UOR Code",
         UOR_Description = "UOR Description")
```




## 3. Combine with sentences ########

```{r, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
memory.limit(size=56000)
comb3 = merge(x=comb2,
              y = Sentences,
              by = c("person_id", "seq_case_id", "ChargeEntityNumber", "ChargeNumber"),
              all.x = TRUE) 

nrow(comb3) == nrow(comb2)
```

__NOTE__: extra rows added to comb3

## check SentenceEntityNumber != ChargeEntityNumber
```{r}
a = Sentences[Sentences$person_id == "62628" & Sentences$seq_case_id == "2775564", ]
b = comb2[comb2$person_id == "62628" & comb2$seq_case_id == "2775564", ]
```

__NOTE__: ChargeNumber != ChargeEntityNumber; ChargeNumber != SentenceEntityNumber; ChargeEntityNumber != SentenceEntityNumber; For each ChargeEntity number, there could be multiple sentenseEntity number corresponded. 

## check unique sentences
```{r}
a = Sentences %>% 
    group_by(person_id, seq_case_id, ChargeEntityNumber, ChargeNumber) %>% 
    summarise(count = n()) %>% 
    arrange(desc(count))
b = a %>% filter(count > 1)
sum(b$count - 1)
```

__NOTE__:

767 is exactly we got for the extra records. It is confirmed that for some charges, there might be more than one sentences. 

## clean names
```{r}
colnames(comb3)
```

```{r}
comb3 = comb3 %>% 
  select(-DispositionTypeCode,
         -DispositionType,
         -DispositionDate,
         -CountyCode.y,
         -County.y,
         -Division.y,
         -ChargeDate.y,
         -CaseNumberType,
         -type,
         -"UOR Code",
         -"UOR Description",
         -UorClass,
         -UorLevel) %>% 
  rename(County = County.x,
         CountyCode = CountyCode.x,
         Division = Division.x,
         ChargeDate = ChargeDate.x)

```

Based on what we need, we can subset any features we want.
